channel.title: The Safehouse News
channel.description: The Rogue Community site for all your MMORPG news!!

item.title: Black Cat and Zipang announced at A-Kon
item.description:
During A-Kon in Dallas, TX, two new titles were announced to be licensed for USA release. The first title announced on Saturday was Black Cat by Funimation. The second title was announced on Sunday by Geneon, Zipang.

Read full story for more info on the titles.

item.title: Solo play arrives in Stormreach
item.description: DUNGEONS & DRAGONS ONLINE: Stormreach; delivers some of the most exciting game play experiences available in online gaming today. Turbine has received tremendous positive feedback on the launch of DDO. Feedback from new players has included the request for more solo-play content as an option to the already fun and challenging group-focused content throughout the game. Turbine has listened to this feedback and is pleased to announce the upcoming availability of solo-friendly content. An all new solo setting is being introduced to help new DDO players navigate through the early game content, allowing them the time and space to learn about their characters, try strategies and face monsters for the first time on their own. Players will now have the option to play at their own pace as a solo-player in the Harbor.

item.title: Issue 7 goes Live
item.description:
After much anticipation, today City of Heroes/Villains' seventh issue (titled 'Destiny Manifest') went live.

Destiny Manifest is a large free update which adds levels 41 to 50 for City of Villains characters, as well as a whole slew of updates including two new zones (a high end PvP zone named 'Recluse's Victory', an alternate reality of Atlas Park where villains and heroes fight for the fate of Paragon City, and Grandville, a high level City of Villains zone).

In addition, Issue 7 introduces new villain powersets (thugs for masterinds,  two electric based powersets for brutes, and two dark energy based powersets for stalkers), Patron Powers for villains over level 40, storage bins for bases, and support for Ageia PhysX cards (in Mayhem Missions only).

You can read the patch notes here.

item.title: Summer 2006 Anime
item.description:
Summer 2006 is coming in three weeks, and it's time for the list! Contrary to the last Spring 2006 season, this one is significantly smaller - with only 29 series, half of last season.

Listed within is all the names, the date they air, and links to the official websites, and summaries. You can find what you are interested in to download right as they come out, otherwise I will be reviewing series and you can check those out too in order to get some idea of what you think you'll like that you have missed.

Despite the significantly smaller size, there's a great variety of shows to be had.  Honey & Clover for the fans of the first season, Tsuyokisu for the eroge adaptation fans, Chokotto Sister for the moe~ crowd, NHK ni Youkoso for the hardcore fans, Coyote Ragtime Show for the shounen fans, Binbo Shimai Monogatari for the slife-of-life fans.

A nice selection, and hopefully a good amount would turn out to be wonderful!

item.title: AMD launches Socket AM2
item.description:
Today AMD launched their new unified desktop socket format, Socket AM2. Socket AM2 is set to replace AMD's socket 939 which will be EOLed (end of life) at the end of this year, and will support both AMD's high end Athlon 64 X2 and FX processors as well as their low end Sempron processors. Socket 754 is set to remain in AMD's lineup throughout the end of 2007 as a way to mantain an inexpensive single channel DDR based platform.

Socket AM2 marks AMD's change from DDR memory to DDR2 memory, as well as the move of their Sempron value lineup from single channel to a dual channel memory format.

Here are several reviews from around the web:

AnandTech
X-Bit Labs
HardOCP
Hot Hardware
ExtremeTech
FiringSquad

item.title: E3: SOE Out of the Box
item.description:
For the past few years Sony Online Entertainment has basically had the same sort of display at E3. A large rectangular black box, one side with windows giving you a tease of the demos and goodies inside, while other sides showing game signage and videos but lacking proper demo boxes. This year they finally broke that model and had several public demo stations outside area as well.

No wonder, you might say, because SOE is now a co-publisher for former rival, Sigil Games Online’s upcoming gem, Vanguard: Saga of Heroes. Add them to Gods and Heroes plus the ongoing SOE titles of EverQuest, EverQuest II, Star Wars Galaxies, Planetside, etc and the Black Box is just about bursting.

item.title: Progression Server to launch in June!
item.description:
SONY ONLINE ENTERTAINMENT ANNOUNCES EVERQUEST PROGRESSION SERVER

"The Combine" Progression Server will allow all players to start on a level playing field as they explore the online world of EverQuest as it was in the beginning

item.title: E3 2006 – Overview and Fricka Awards
item.description: E3 2006 has just ended so it must be time to give out awards. Fricka  tells a bit about her E3 experience and gives out her own Awards.

item.title: E3 2006 Photos for Wednesday
item.description: First batch of photos are up from Fricka's E3 meetings and meanderings.

item.title: Quick Note - WoW New Alliance Race: Draenei
item.description:
Blizzard finally showed off the new Alliance race named the Draenei. They are satyr-like creatures with hooves but have a reptilian looking tail.

Not much detail was given about this new race as everything is "not set yet". Classes are not announced though the demo allowed you to choose a warrior or paladin to play. There was also a hunter trainer I spotted in the starting city of Ammen Vale.

High resolution pictures will be coming tonight as well as official screenshots.

If you must have something to ponder, here's a very blurry camera picture of one log in screen model:

Here's one of the model at the booth display:
